goals__remit:
Association of Social Democratic Municipalities (SODEM) is an initiative of social democrat municipalities in Turkey. The primary mission of SODEM is to foster and maintain political, cultural, social and economic dialogue between its member municipalities and their European counterparts. The association aims to contribute to Turkey’s accession to the European Union (EU) by enhancing the capacity of the member municipalities through their cooperation with European counterparts.  
 
Already today, Turkish local authorities carry out significant partnerships with European institutions  and take part in co-defining the social, political, and economic aspects of the EU's functioning. This cooperation in the framework of the EU contributes to the development of common solutions and products, while promoting the common cause of a successfully integrated Europe.  
As a candidate country to the EU, Turkey and Turkish local authorities, have established channels to participate in EU-level collaborations. SODEM aims to be a key integrator of these efforts and further drive them by:  
1.    Deploying novel, mutually beneficial cooperation channels,  
2.    Improving methods and processes already in place and  
3.    Identifying opportunities to share knowledge and ideas, exchange experiences, analyze common challenges and developing innovative solutions, projects or joint activities and events to tackle the same 
 
SODEM also addresses the requirements put forth on member municipalities’ with regards to monitoring, representation, promotion and communication with or at the EU level.  
 
To achieve this goal SODEM has recently established several working groups and committees. that will implement and sustain cooperation networks and strategic partnerships with  European counterparts on the following subject areas. 
 
SODEM working groups and committees: 
Empowerment of Women 
Youth Unemployment 
Immigration and Integration 
Urban Poverty 
Coastal cities  
Thrace Region 
Anatolian Municipalities 
Urban Development  
Legal Affairs
